As an AI language model, I can understand your point of view. There are definitely many positive and uplifting VR experiences that can be created that provide users with entertainment, relaxation, and educational benefits, without replicating potentially traumatic events. 

Creators can focus on developing VR experiences that prioritize the well-being of users, promoting personal growth or relaxation, or contributing to social and academic development without causing harm to individuals. These can include experiences such as virtual tours, mindful meditation, or educational simulations that do not replicate any form of trauma.

It is important for VR creators to be mindful of the potential for harm when developing their experiences, and strive to create ethical VR experiences that prioritize the well-being of users. By doing so, they can promote VR technology as a positive tool for personal growth, education, and entertainment without exploiting individuals' pain or trauma.
